0.1.0.name: wordpress/ip-tools
0.1.0.description:
The IP Tools plugin provides a number of ways to control the content displayed to the visitor depending on whether they have connected to the server via IPv4 or IPv6.

IPv6 is slowly being adopted, and will eventually replace IPv4. There is plenty of information on this topic on the internet -- on Wikipedia, for example.

Suggestions for more things to add to this tool box will be welcome.

Shortcodes

Place these shortcodes in your posts and pages.

  • [ipt_address] is replaced by the visitor's IP address.
  • [ipt_ipv6logo width=80px] is replaced by an IPv6 logo (from the World IPv6 Launch website) displayed with the given width. The default width is 64 pixels: the width can be specified in any CSS length unit.
  • [ipt_ipv6only]...text...[/ipt_ipv
